com.fluidops.ajax.components

Class FPopupWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fluidops.ajax.components.FComponent
      • com.fluidops.ajax.components.FContainer
        • com.fluidops.ajax.components.FPopupWindow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FEventListener

    public class FPopupWindow
extends FContainer
    Component that shows a (page-) modal message box. The singleton instance of popup window can be obtained through FPage.getPopupWindow
    Author:
    uli, aeb

      • addButton

        public void addButton(java.lang.String label,
             java.lang.Runnable okAction)
        Add a button with user defined label and action. The button is added with floatLeft behavior. On click the popup window instance is hidden.
        Parameters:
        label -
        okAction -

        Description copied from class: FContainer

        message - to display

      • yesNoDialog

        public void yesNoDialog(java.lang.String message,
               FEventListener yes,
               FEventListener no)
        Shows a yes/no dialog with the specified message and executes the specified callbacks if a button is being clicked. Callback actions typically are anonymous implementations of the one-method event callback interface. If one of the callbacks is null, the dialog just closes when the user clicks the associated button.
        Parameters:
        message - Message text.
        yes - Callback to be executed when the user clicks 'Yes'.
        no - Callback to be executed when the user clicks 'No'.

      • yesNoDialog

        public void yesNoDialog(java.lang.String message,
               java.lang.String title,
               FEventListener yes,
               FEventListener no)
        Same as yesNoDialog(String, FEventListener, FEventListener), however with a user defined title.

      • yesNoCancelDialog

        public void yesNoCancelDialog(java.lang.String message,
                     FEventListener yes,
                     FEventListener no,
                     FEventListener cancel)
        Shows an yes/no/cancel dialog with the specified message and executes the specified callbacks if a button is being clicked. Callback actions typically are anonymous implementations of the one-method event callback interface. If one of the callbacks is null, the dialog just closes when the user clicks the associated button.
        Parameters:
        message - Message text.
        yes - Callback to be executed when the user clicks 'Yes'.
        no - Callback to be executed when the user clicks 'No'.
        no - Callback to be executed when the user clicks 'No'.

      • yesNoCancelDialog

        public void yesNoCancelDialog(java.lang.String message,
                     java.lang.String title,
                     FEventListener yes,
                     FEventListener no,
                     FEventListener cancel)
        Same as yesNoCancelDialog(String, FEventListener, FEventListener, FEventListener) , however with a user defined title.

      • okCancelDialog

        public void okCancelDialog(java.lang.String message,
                  FEventListener ok,
                  FEventListener cancel)
        Shows an ok/cancel dialog with the specified message and executes the specified callbacks if a button is being clicked. Callback actions typically are anonymous implementations of the one-method event callback interface. If one of the callbacks is null, the dialog just closes when the user clicks the associated button.
        Parameters:
        message - Message text.
        ok - Callback to be executed when the user clicks 'OK'.
        cancel - Callback to be executed when the user clicks 'Cancel'.

      • okCancelDialog

                  java.lang.String title,
                  FEventListener ok,
                  FEventListener cancel)
        Same as okCancelDialog(String, FEventListener, FEventListener), however with a user defined title.
